CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:44): Couple questions about correct behavior:  1. Should users be able to register skins without PR?  2. Should skins be able to define macros which override global macros?  
sdumitriu - (17:49): 1: Yes  
sdumitriu - (17:49): 2: Yes, but only locally  
sdumitriu - (17:49): As in, as long as that skin is used  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:50): So it's correct behavior that I can join a wiki, upload a skin, view PR pages with that skin...  
sdumitriu - (17:50): For "no", there's a simple velocity property which needs to be set, which prevents a template from redefining a global macro  
sdumitriu - (17:50): No, that's not correct  
sdumitriu - (17:50): A skin should NEVER have PR  
sdumitriu - (17:51): PR should only apply to content inside documents  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:51): It doesn't have to if the PR document calls macros which I defined.  
sdumitriu - (17:51): This is the behavior that's bad right now  
sdumitriu - (17:51): Hm, right  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:51): That's why I was asking if it's correct/policy.  
sdumitriu - (17:51): Well, documents should not call macros  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:52): ??  (then what are they there for?)  
sdumitriu - (17:52): For skins  
sdumitriu - (17:52): That is, velocity macros  
sdumitriu - (17:53): 2.0 macros cannot be defined in skins, so that's not a problem  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:53): Well if this is incorrect behavior I think we need a bug, if it's correct we need a big warning on the scripting page.  
sdumitriu - (17:53): 1.0 macros should disappear  
sdumitriu - (17:54): That's just my view  
sdumitriu - (17:54): WDYT?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:54): 1.0 meaning velocity?  I don't know. I think they could be fixed if handled better.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:55): I'm not a big fan of the giant templates folder.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:55): It's nice to be able to break up a script by putting it in velocity macros though.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:01): I'll put it to the list. It's too easy for a user to say #lightbox and not know that it might be a security issue.
